senses.de: A listed collection of items or things, usually in a systematic order.
senses.ex: The library has a catalogue of all the books they have.

Tips.title: Systematic Order
Tips.description: Items in a catalogue are organized in a structured way, which can be by category, alphabetically, or by date.
Tips.example: The museum’s catalogue listed the artifacts chronologically.

Tips.title: Comprehensive Detail
Tips.description: Catalogues often include details like descriptions, prices, or characteristics to inform readers.
Tips.example: The seed catalogue includes pictures and growing conditions for each plant.

Tips.title: Library Context
Tips.description: A 'library catalogue' is a common usage, referring to a database of books and resources found in the library.
Tips.example: Check the library catalogue to see if they have the newest novel.

senses.de: To make a systematic list of items or things.
senses.ex: She spent her time cataloguing all the items in her antique collection.

Tips.title: Record Keeping
Tips.description: 'To catalogue' means to record items systematically for easy retrieval and organization.
Tips.example: The archivist has to catalogue the letters by subject and date.

Tips.title: Research Importance
Tips.description: Cataloguing is crucial in research for maintaining an organized collection of data or specimens.
Tips.example: Researchers catalogued the soil samples before analysis.

senses.de: A printed booklet advertising a selection of products that can be purchased.
senses.ex: I received a catalogue from the clothing store in the mail.

Tips.title: Marketing Tool
Tips.description: Catalogues as booklets are used by companies to showcase products and encourage sales.
Tips.example: The winter clothing catalogue features the latest sweater designs.

Tips.title: Mail Distribution
Tips.description: 'Mail-order catalogue' suggests the catalogue is sent to customers through the postal service.
Tips.example: I used to order clothes from a mail-order catalogue.

Tips.title: Product Information
Tips.description: Product catalogues are more detailed, often listing specifications, which help consumers make informed decisions.
Tips.example: Before buying the camera, I looked through the product catalogue for its features.

Directory.wordDefinition:
A directory is a list of information about people or places.

A catalogue is used to list items for sale or borrowing, while a directory is used to list information about people or places.

Index.wordDefinition:
Index refers to a list of words or topics found in a book or document, along with page numbers indicating where they can be found.

An index is used to help readers easily locate specific information within a larger work, such as a textbook or novel.

Catalogue is used to list items to purchase, while index is used to search for specific information in a larger work.

Inventory.wordDefinition:
A catalogue is a list of items that a business offers for sale, while an inventory is a record of all the items a business has in stock at a given time.

Catalogues are used mainly for advertising and marketing purposes to showcase a business's products to potential customers, while inventories are used for internal management and tracking purposes to ensure that a business has enough stock to meet customer demand.

The store will also keep an inventory of all the clothing items they have in stock at any given time, to make sure they have enough to fulfill customer orders and keep their shelves stocked.

A catalogue is a list of items that a business is offering for sale and is mainly used for advertising and marketing, while an inventory is a record of all the items a business has in stock at any given time and is mainly used for internal management and tracking.

List.wordDefinition:
A list is a simple and straightforward collection of items without much detail.

It can be used for various purposes such as making a grocery list, to-do list or a guest list for a party. Lists are usually shorter than catalogues and are meant to be easily understood without any unnecessary information.

A catalogue is more detailed and used by businesses to showcase their products, while a list is simpler and can be used for various purposes.

Menu.wordDefinition:
A menu is a list of food and drink items offered by a restaurant that customers can order from. Menus often include descriptions of dishes, prices, and dietary information.

A menu is a tool for the customer to choose what food they will eat at a restaurant.

A catalogue is a list of products for sale, while a menu is a list of food and drink items available for ordering at a restaurant.

Record.wordDefinition:
Both catalogue and record can refer to a list or collection of items, but they have slightly different meanings and connotations.

Record often suggests a more detailed and permanent documentation of something, such as a historical event or a person's accomplishments.

For example, a museum might keep records of all the artifacts in its collection, including information about where they came from, their age, and their significance.

Catalogue is more commonly used in a commercial or retail context, while record is more often used in academic or archival contexts.

Register.wordDefinition:
A catalogue refers to a comprehensive list or collection of items, while a register refers to an official record of names, details, or events.

A register is used for recording and keeping track of specific information in a more formal and official manner. For example, a school might maintain a register of students, recording their names, ages, grades, and attendance records.

A catalogue is a collection of information organized for presentation, while a register is an official record for documentation purposes.

Roster.wordDefinition:
A roster is a list of people or things in a particular order, usually for organizational purposes or to keep track of schedules.

For example, a sports team may have a roster of players, or a school may have a roster of teachers.

A catalogue is a list of items for sale, while a roster is a list of people or things in a particular order or for organizational purposes.

Catalogues are typically used by businesses to promote products, while rosters are used for scheduling and organizing.

Schedule.wordDefinition:
Catalogue refers to a list of items or products that are available for purchase, while schedule refers to a plan for events or activities to take place at specific times.

Catalogues are used in retail or e-commerce settings to showcase available products, while schedules are used in planning events, meetings or classes.

A 15-year-old would commonly encounter catalogues in shopping, while schedules might be applicable in school or extracurricular activities.

quotes.Text: When you raise a child, you don't sit down and take all the rules of life, write them into a big catalog, and start reading the child all these individual rules from A to Z. When we raise a child, a lot of what we do is let the child experiment and guide the experimentation. The child basically has to process his own data and learn from experience.
quotes.Title: German Scientist
quotes.Name: Sebastian Thrun

quotes.Text: I did some pretty embarrassing modeling, like catalogs and QVC. I know there's probably a stereotype where all pretty girls think they're unattractive, but modeling is the worst thing for your self-esteem, because you're never pretty enough, you're never thin enough.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Whitney Cummings

quotes.Text: Games take years to make, and it's important that when we launch, it can't just be a great launch catalog and then a desert for a really long time. To be honest, for a lot of developers, they'd rather not be competing at launch with all this other software.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Palmer Luckey

quotes.Text: The problem with the Moodies is not what to play, it's what to leave out! That's always difficult. We stopped having support acts many years ago just because of that. We needed getting on to two hours; there's such a big catalog to call on.
quotes.Title: British Musician
quotes.Name: Justin Hayward

quotes.Text: I went to my school careers counselors and said I wanted to be an actor, and they didn't know what to do. They showed me catalogues with pretty campuses and said, 'Oh, look, there's a theater building. Why don't you go there?
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Frances McDormand

quotes.Text: All of the people we admire have extensive catalogs, so what's most exciting about people responding well to the band is allowing us to continue making as many records as we can.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Taylor Goldsmith

quotes.Text: Ultimately, I'd like to create a body of work where every album has its own personality and a reason to exist within the catalog, not just 'more of the same.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Steven Wilson

quotes.Text: It's part of being successful, just planning your life, catalogue successes, keep track of things that are important to you and make them a reality.
quotes.Title: American Mixed Martial Artist
quotes.Name: Frank Shamrock

quotes.Text: For me, the card catalog has been a companion all my working life. To leave it is like leaving the house one was brought up in.
quotes.Title: American Historian
quotes.Name: Barbara W. Tuchman

quotes.Text: I just want to leave this world with a massive catalog of songs.
quotes.Title: Australian Musician
quotes.Name: Nick Cave
